revised_title: Analytic Properties of the Ising Model with Triplet Interactions on the Triangular Lattice
tldr: The authors investigate the analytic properties of the Ising model with triplet interactions on the triangular lattice, focusing on the Baxter-Wu solution. They show that the free energy per spin can be written explicitly in terms of an algebraic hypergeometric function and derive recurrence relations for the coefficients in the low-temperature expansions. The study establishes the critical behavior of the free energy, internal energy, and specific heat in the neighborhood of the critical point.
